description: Binance Alpha has removed 18 tokens from its featured listing pool as part of its ongoing quality review process. The affected tokens are no longer available for new purchases but can still be traded through other means. Earlier this year, Binance implemented a stricter evaluation framework requiring projects to meet both qualitative and quantitative benchmarksâ€”covering liquidity, trading volume, community strength, and compliance. The move underscores Binanceâ€™s focus on maintaining credibility and reducing risks from low-activity or non-compliant assets, turning Alpha into a curated space for high-quality early-access tokens.

author: â€“ The Coin CartelÂ®
description:
The Federal Reserve delivered a widely expected 25-basis-point rate cut on October 29, bringing the target range down to 3.75%â€“4.00% â€” the first easing move in months. However, what truly unsettled the markets was Fed Chair Jerome Powellâ€™s statement that a further cut in December is â€œnot a foregone conclusion.â€

Powellâ€™s remarks signaled a deep divide within the FOMC over the pace of monetary easing, leaving traders uncertain about policy direction heading into year-end. The reaction was swift â€” Bitcoin slid roughly 3%, while Ethereum, XRP, and other altcoins lost between 2% and 5%, as risk sentiment soured across digital assets.

Analysts say the crypto market could face heightened volatility in November, with macro signals now taking the driverâ€™s seat for Bitcoinâ€™s next major move.

The claim quickly drew backlash from the exchange, with Faryar Shirzad, Coinbaseâ€™s Chief Policy Officer, calling the allegation â€œcompletely ridiculous.â€

Shirzad emphasized that Coinbaseâ€™s support for Fairshake â€” a pro-crypto political action committee â€” is strictly nonpartisan, aimed at promoting fair and forward-looking crypto regulations across both political parties.

Coinbase reiterated that its mission is to empower crypto adoption, not engage in partisan politics, adding that building a healthy regulatory environment benefits the entire digital asset ecosystem â€” regardless of who holds office.
